meanings.definition: The quality of being astute or sharp in practical matters.
meanings.sent1: Her shrewdness in business helped her make wise investments.
meanings.sent2: His shrewdness in negotiations always led to favorable outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The detective's shrewdness in solving the case surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the tricky situation with the shrewdness of a seasoned diplomat.
meanings.sent5: The old owl's shrewdness in hunting at night was unmatched.

meanings.definition: The ability to make good judgments and quick decisions.
meanings.sent1: Using his shrewdness, he avoided the traffic jam by taking a different route.
meanings.sent2: Her shrewdness in choosing the right candidate for the job impressed the team.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed shrewdness in catching the mouse by pretending to sleep.
meanings.sent4: His shrewdness in picking stocks earned him a fortune in the market.
meanings.sent5: The captain's shrewdness in changing course saved the ship from the storm.

meanings.definition: Cleverness or intelligence in understanding and dealing with situations.
meanings.sent1: The magician amazed the audience with his shrewdness in performing tricks.
meanings.sent2: Her shrewdness in solving puzzles made her the champion of the game.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's shrewdness in stealing bananas from the kitchen was comical.
meanings.sent4: He used his shrewdness to outsmart his opponents in the chess tournament.
meanings.sent5: The fox's shrewdness in outwitting the hunter saved its life.
